meanings.definition: In a way that is at right angles to a given line or surface.
meanings.sent1: The flagpole stood perpendicularly to the ground.
meanings.sent2: She held the ruler perpendicularly against the edge of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb perpendicularly up the tree trunk but slipped comically.
meanings.sent4: His strict principles stood perpendicularly against the relaxed atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper soared perpendicularly into the sky, casting a long shadow.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is straight up or down.
meanings.sent1: The elevator moved perpendicularly from the ground floor to the top floor.
meanings.sent2: The rain fell perpendicularly, drenching everything below.
meanings.sent3: The balloon floated perpendicularly upwards, surprising the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her mood shifted perpendicularly from joy to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall cascaded perpendicularly down the cliff, creating a mesmerizing sight.
